intro: Trisetum transcaucasicum var. ciliatifolium, commonly known as the ciliated feathergrass, is a grass species native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and fine, linear leaves with ciliate margins. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species within its native range.
